result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Keith Sylvas

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Brian Keith Sylvas.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel held over in trial and unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present due to being off of work this date. Defense objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared via zoom.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held in person/via zoom.  Defense requesting  preliminary hearing.     Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
The court will grant defense request and order the matter adjourned for Preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 15. CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. Defendant appears in court and provided with court slip for next court date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 15. Case set for Hearing as to Status of Counsel. Attorney Harris has been appointed on this matter. Defendant does not appear. Upon motion of defense, the Court will issue but stay a warrant until 10:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas in court, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised defendant qualifies for public defender representation.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas in court.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for indigency hearing.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Defendant may qualify for public defender representation.  Case passed for further evaluation.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas in court, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing. Defendant is reminded of the no contact order that remains in effect.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Luis M. L. (dob 2/15/2015). With the exception of Incidental contact as it may occur on school grounds.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian Keith Sylvas in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/22/2022 @01:30pm
